definition: to touch an elephant (of proverbial blind people)
to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract
variant of 摹[mo2]
elephant/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/shape/form/appearance/to imitate

blind people touch an elephant (idiom, from Nirvana sutra 大般涅槃經|大般涅盘经[da4 ban1 Nie4 pan2 jing1]); fig. unable to see the big picture/to mistake the part for the whole/unable to see the wood for the trees

blind people touch an elephant (idiom, from Nirvana sutra 大般涅槃經|大般涅盘经[da4 ban1 Nie4 pan2 jing1]); fig. unable to see the big picture/to mistake the part for the whole/unable to see the wood for the trees
to touch an elephant with closed eyes (idiom); to proceed blindly

multitude of blind people touch an elephant (idiom, from Nirvana sutra 大般涅槃經|大般涅盘经[da4 ban1 Nie4 pan2 jing1]); fig. unable to see the big picture/to mistake the part for the whole/unable to see the wood for the trees

blind people touch an elephant (idiom, from Nirvana sutra 大般涅槃經|大般涅盘经[da4 ban1 Nie4 pan2 jing1]); fig. unable to see the big picture/to mistake the part for the whole/unable to see the wood for the trees

multitude of blind people touch an elephant (idiom, from Nirvana sutra 大般涅槃經|大般涅盘经[da4 ban1 Nie4 pan2 jing1]); fig. unable to see the big picture/to mistake the part for the whole/unable to see the wood for the trees
lit. eyes obscured by a single leaf (idiom)/fig. not seeing the wider picture/can't see the wood for the trees
lit. the eye cannot see the eyelashes (idiom); fig. unable to see one's own faults/to lack self-awareness/truths too close to home
lit. to scoop the moon out of the water (idiom)/a hopeless endeavor
the view of a frog in a well (idiom); fig. a narrow view
partial view/limited outlook
to cut the feet to fit the shoes (idiom); to force sth to fit (as to a Procrustean bed)/impractical or inelegant solution
braille
to jump to an unfounded conclusion
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
lit. to see a leopard through a narrow tube (idiom); fig. to miss the big picture
see 捕風捉影|捕风捉影[bu3 feng1 zhuo1 ying3]
to see the ox already cut up into joints (idiom); extremely skilled/able to see through the problem at one glance
short-sighted/limited vision
